review_title: Felt the effects at first use
review_text: As I prepared the tea I was skeptical because of the peculiar aroma. However I found the taste pretty neutral and relatively easy to consume. I was fairly surprised by the effects I felt the next morning. I had had a late dinner and was dreading a night of tossing and turning but lo and behold I slept through the night and the next morning I woke fresh with no residual effects of the dinner from previous night. I researched all the benefits of the blend and while they do help with anxiety and depression they are also great for digestion and menopause symptoms. I’m so glad I ordered two packs and can’t wait for my next cup!

review_title: A great addition to bedtime routine
review_text:
I recently tried Organic Nighty Night Extra with Lemon Balm & Valerian, and I’m impressed with its calming effects. As someone who occasionally struggles with falling asleep, I found this tea to be a natural and gentle solution.

If you’re looking for a natural, soothing way to help with sleep or manage stress, I highly recommend Organic Nighty Night Extra. It works well without harsh side effects, making it a great addition to my bedtime routine.

Pros:

	•	Relaxing, calming effects
	•	Organic and non-GMO ingredients
	•	No morning grogginess

Cons:

	•	The taste might not appeal to everyone, especially if you’re sensitive to valerian’s earthiness.

The Organic Nighty Night Extra tea has become my go-to evening ritual for promoting relaxation and better sleep. The combination of lemon balm and valerian root provides a calming effect that helps ease my mind after a long day.  Its effectiveness in promoting relaxation and better sleep, combined with its delightful flavor and quality ingredients, makes it a standout choice for anyone looking to enhance their nighttime routine

It features organic ingredients, which is always a plus in my book. The tea bags are individually wrapped, preserving the freshness and potency of the herbs. The packaging is also environmentally friendly, which aligns with my preference for sustainable products. Known for its calming properties, lemon balm has a gentle, pleasant flavor that adds a refreshing note to the tea.

Added this tea into my nighttime routine and it works wonders! I struggle with sleeping and this really helps, the benefits are great! No caffeine, lovely herbal blend taste, and makes me feel quite sleepy. Really good quality with natural ingredients. I use this frequently every night, better than chamomile in my opinion.

I ordered this because I wanted to help myself get to sleep at night. I honestly feel like this works well without carrying side effects into the morning like melatonin or a sleep aid would do. I don't drink it often but on nights where I am wound up, it has helped me.

With the very effective sleepy time herb, Valerian, leading the list, the formula includes other well known relaxing and sleep promoting favorites and also a couple that can calm and settle an upset stomach and so help a person to relax. Also the herbalists favorite, Licorice root adds to the flavor and helps balance the formula well.  the taste of the tea is delightful and i like to add a little raw honey to it as well. It has the same high quality that i have come to associate with this brand!

I’ve been drinking a cup of this tea about an hour before bed for the last few months. It definitely helps me to relax, and is a nice little wind down ritual. The taste is herbal and pleasant without being too strong. Usually I’ll refill my cup with boiling water two or three times (with the teabag still in) to get some extra hydration before bed. I wouldn't say it’s an instant fix for those with sleep issues, but it definitely helps with relaxing the body and mind a little before bedtime.

review_title: tremendous benefit for the central nervous system and the muscular system
review_text:
Valerian is a medicinal herb and root that has significant sedative and tranquilizing properties that can provide tremendous benefit to both the central nervous system and the muscular system. Valerian contains calcium, manganese, quercitin, and ascorbic acid as well as valepotriate and isovaleric acid which gives it its calming and relaxing qualities. 

It is especially beneficial for chronic insomnia, headaches, nervousness, menstrual problems, and anxiety. It is also helpful in soothing the digestive tract and cramps associated with irritable bowel syndrome. Valerian is also known to be very beneficial for the cardiovascular system and overall heart health. 

Valerian can also be used to help control hunger and reduce the urge to eat out of stress. It has been shown to be beneficial in reducing seizure activity and is often combined with other herbs such as lemon balm, hops, and passionflower for increased relaxation and healing benefits. Valerian is most often taken as a supplement in a capsule, tincture, or tea form and can be readily found online or at your local health food store.

review_title: Embrace Tranquility with Traditional Medicinals Organic Nighty Night Extra Tea
review_text:
Traditional Medicinals Organic Nighty Night Extra Tea has quickly become my favorite go-to remedy for unwinding after a busy day and preparing for a restful night's sleep. Crafted with care using organic lemon balm and valerian, this caffeine-free herbal blend offers a gentle yet effective solution for promoting relaxation and tranquility.

What sets this tea apart is its unique combination of herbs, each selected for its calming properties and ability to soothe the mind and body. Lemon balm is renowned for its calming effects, helping to alleviate stress and tension, while valerian root adds a deeper layer of relaxation, promoting a sense of calmness and well-being.

From the moment I open the box, I'm greeted by the delicate aroma of the herbs, which instantly helps me to unwind and relax. I appreciate knowing that I'm sipping on a blend that is crafted with organic ingredients, free from artificial additives or preservatives, ensuring a pure and natural tea-drinking experience.

Not only does this tea taste delicious, but it also delivers on its promise of promoting restful sleep. I've found that brewing a cup of Traditional Medicinals Nighty Night Extra Tea before bedtime helps me to relax and prepare for sleep, allowing me to wake up feeling refreshed and rejuvenated each morning.

The convenience of the individually wrapped tea bags makes it easy to enjoy a cup of this calming blend wherever I go. Whether I'm at home or traveling, I can always rely on Traditional Medicinals to provide a moment of tranquility whenever I need it most.

In conclusion, I highly recommend Traditional Medicinals Organic Nighty Night Extra Tea to anyone seeking a natural and effective way to promote relaxation and support a restful night's sleep. With its carefully selected blend of organic herbs and soothing aroma, this tea is sure to become a cherished part of your nightly routine.

review_title: Traditional medicinals nighty night extra tea
review_text: Nighty night extra tea is an excellent beverage . It helps to improve the quality of sleep.. The herbal blend is perfect.  Smooth taste. The package size could be more though.

review_text: Quality of the tea bags seems fine. Not sure as to the actual effects of sleep improvement based on my own use. Giving this a 3 star as I appreciate that one who prefers the flavor may have a higher opinion for this product.

I used to drink camomile before bedtime, but since I've been suffering from insomnia lately, I decided to try something new that's caffeine free. First time to drink Valerian tea. For me, I didn't really enjoy the herb flavor, but that isn't to say it's unpleasant. I think I just enjoy something naturally sweeter tasting. Also, not sure if it helped with my sleep, but that might just be because my insomnia is pretty severe. The nice thing is that they're individually packaged, so you don't have to rush to finish drinking them all.

It does what it says as the composition is really well made but I really dislike the taste of it. I tried to mix it with some other herb tea with a strong taste but even then, the weird medication taste was still quite outputting. 
So, I drink it fast, just for the sleeping help it provides but I can't say it is relaxing to drink your cup of tea like it's a challenge.
I let some of my friends tried. And they fell in love with it. They used to have insomnia and said they felt sleepy not long after consuming it.

My husband works notorious shifts at the hospital and I tried this for two days in a row when he returned from night shift and he slept like a baby for a good 8 hours and felt refreshed upon waking up. Another great Tea from this brand! Nighty Night Tea is the a great tea for a blissful sleep. This high-quality blend of soothing herbs, including passion flower, valerian root, and lemon balm, delivers on its promise of tranquility and relaxation. A very nice brew before bed. I'd say it helps me sleep more deeply most of the time when I use it. And I tend to use it only occasionally. It's quite potent, so I'll often save half of my mugful for the next night. Naturally, this product doesn't contain any caffeine. The taste is earthy. I don't mind it, but some might not like it.

review_title: good but not the same as nighty night (without the extra)
review_text: I accidentally bought this instead of nighty night. The extra has a change in ingredients. Somehow this one doesn't work on me like nighty night. Nighty night helps me fall asleep. This one doesn't. Other than that, I can't tell if the quality is good since I bought it to sleep.

I tried Traditional Medicinals Organic Nighty Night Extra Tea and overall, my experience was slightly better than average. The tea contains valerian root, which is known for its calming properties and is believed to help with insomnia.

The tea comes in the form of 16 wrapped tea bags, which is convenient for traveling or on-the-go use. I found that it helped me relax and fall asleep more easily.

However, one downside of this product is that it has a distinct and strong smell which some people may find off-putting. The smell is quite pungent and is not the most pleasant. I found that it reminded me of dirty laundry water....

Other than that, I would recommend Traditional Medicinals Organic Nighty Night Extra Tea to anyone looking for a natural and effective remedy for insomnia. It's a slightly-better-than-average product that provides a good balance of benefits.

But the effect kicks in around half an hour in.

This product really works.  Within 20 minutes, I am off to sleep.  After I drink the tea, I dont worry, since I know it does its job.  I usually drink the tea when I wake up at 3AM or so and cant get back to sleep.  I get up right away to prepare the tea.  I know in short time I will be back to sleep.  Sometimes, I might have trouble getting to sleep when I originally go to bed,  So i'll prepare a cup.  In no time I am on my way to restful sleep.

My mom and my husband both have sleeping issue. Both always like to wake up in the middle of the night (sometimes 1 time, sometimes few times). In other words, they don't have good sleep quality. After this this tea bag (1st time),  both can sleep soundly and do not have to wake up in the middle of the night (just wake up early).

I love this tea and it really does help me have a better nigh's sleep. The smell of the tea can be strong for some people, as valerian is quite pungent, but the taste is nice as it has been mixed well with other herbs. I usually take it about an hour before sleeping if I feel I need it. It doesn't leave me feeling like a sleeping tablet does in the morning. It is more gentle but still effective. I have ordered it several times.

review_title: As well as it can be
review_text: I just started on adaptogens and how it helps our body systems.  I like this tea, although its doesn’t have the best taste for us( probably bec. of licorice, although it is good for your gut amonst other things), but it works well in terms of sleep, not just the valerian but the mix of the other herbs as well.  It really does help with sleep esp. during times of stress.  It stabilizes your nervous system. And then you wake up refreshed and traces of stress gone. This tea is very handy.  Careful though with those with hypertension.  Pls do not take licorice often.

This tea doesn't make me sleepy, but gives me the deepest, uninterrupted sleep once I knock out. Even if I do wake up to use the bathroom, I can fall asleep within minutes after. Usually I lie awake for hours. 

It definitely has a really funky smell like stinky gym socks, but the taste isn't bad at all.

review_title: Highly recommended for those having trouble sleeping.
review_text:
It is amazing. I work different hours at work and it is very difficult for me to fall asleep when needed. 

I am skeptical of teas but this one really works efficiently and fast as I am already sleeping within an hour of taking a cup of it. I would highly recommend it. 

I would not recommend it if driving or operating machines as it is sleep inducing.

If you do shift work like me,  and are looking for some help to reset your sleep schedule, a cup of Valerian root tea before bed works very well.  Valerian root's biggest obstacle to more mainstream acceptance is that it smells like a horse's *ss - but this formulation has taken care of the stank problem. This tea combined with supplemental melatonin, has done wonders for improving my sleep quality.

I have used several different brands of chamomile tea that didn't help any.  When I saw this Valerian combination  I tried it and I am ready to go to bed soon after I drink it.  I have had such a problem falling to sleep and it is such a relief to have finally found a product that works for me.  Thanks Traditional Medicinals.
